Metadata: The reproductive cycle of the tropical top shell, "Trochus niloticus", in French Polynesia

"Trochus niloticus", tropical top shell, is the most economically important gastropod in the tropical Pacific, and is both an important traditional food and a leading export item. Its reproduction is not similar to any previously described prosobranch. The population as a whole was asynchronous; nevertheless, the population contained several sub-groups that had synchronized reproductive cycles. The reproductive cycle was approximately eight lunar months. "T. niloticus" was a complete spawner with each individual having only one cohort of gametes developing at a time.
